intro: Gomphostemma intermedium, commonly known as the intermediate gomphostemma, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae, which includes milkweeds, and is characterized by its milky sap and distinctive floral structures. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to drought conditions. Its flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow, with five to seven lobes, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Gomphostemma intermedium is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
